The Independence of a Continent

[ICON_OCCUPIED]Occupied cities start with a Courthouse. Liberating a Civilization or a [ICON_CITY_STATE]City-State starts a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE]Golden Age. Great People may be turned into Libertadores, losing the ability of building Citadels.
Llanero
The Llanero has a combat bonus on Open terrain, and also transfers its movement to Libertadores, unlike the Lancer which it replaces.
The Llaneros have a lot of mobility and their ability to increase the movement of Libertadores can help in changing the tide of battle.
Joropo
Increased Combat Bonus in Open Terrain (No Hills, No Forests, No Jungle). Movement speed transferred to near Great Generals.
Libertador
Replacement of the Great General. The Libertador grants a bonus against cities when adjacent to a city. It can also add turns of Golden Age for the Empire.
As a replacement for the Great Generals, the Libertadores get an important advantage, as the extra combat strenght near cities can prove handy when conquering or liberating cities.
Padre de la Patria
Gives +50% bonus vs. Cities to all friendly units within 2 tiles, but not on the same tile, of the Libertador when adjacent to a city.
Recruit Great Person
Turn this Great Person into a Libertador (The Libertador won't be able of building Citadels). Costs 100 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
You either don't have enough [ICON_CULTURE] Culture to perform this action or the unit is not on a land tile inside your territory.
